application_type_full: Outline planning permission: Some matters reserved
description:
Redevelopment of the site to provide warehouse and
associated facilities in a double-height building at the
southern end of the site and to use the remainder of the
site for parking and circulation of vehicles associated
with Parcel Force's operation  plus boundary walls and
associated landscaping works  as shown on drawing nos.
9024/SS/120C  121B  122B  123B  124  201  111F
9024/B020  B006A  008B  053/01A  02A. revised by letters
28.08.92  23.10.92 and 06.11.92.
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The means of access and egress suitable for people with
    disabilities to and from the site and to and from the
    visitors parking area shall be provided prior to the
    completion of Phase 2, and permanently retained as such.

Condition : 2 - Car parking for 28 staff vehicles, of which not less than 3
    spaces shall be designed and identified for the use of
    disabled drivers shall be provided prior to the completion
    of Phase 2, and shall be permanently retained as such.

Condition : 3 - No less than three car parking spaces shall be provided for
    members of the public visiting the site, not less than one
    of which shall be designed and identified for the use of
    disabled drivers. These spaces shall be permanently
    retained as such.

Condition : 4 - No less than 20 covered cycle parking spaces shall be
    provided for employees working on the site.

Condition : 5 - The details of the elevations and facing materials to be
    used on the building shall not be otherwise than as shall
    have been submitted to and approved by the Council before
    any work on the site is commenced.

Condition : 6 - Full particulars of the railings to be used in the
    development shall be submitted to and approved by the
    Council before any work on the relevant part of the
    development is commenced.

Condition : 7 - Detailed drawings showing a section through the boundary
    wall and railings on the Pratt Street frontage shall be
    submitted to and approved by the Council before any work on
    Phase 2 of the development is commenced.

Condition : 8 - No pipes or plumbing, other than rainwater pipes, shall be
    fixed on the external face of the building.

Condition : 9 - Detailed drawings of a planting scheme which shall include
    planted season of the completion of each Phase of the
    development, unless otherwise agreed in writing by the
    Council. Any trees or areas of planting which, within a
    period of 5 years from the completion of the development,
    die, are removed or become seriously damaged or diseased
    shall be replaced as soon as is reasonably possible and in
    any case by not leter than the end of the following
    planting season with others of similar size and species
    unless the Council gives written consent to any variation.
    the number, size, species and location of trees and shrubs
    to be planted in association of Phase 1 of the development
    shall be submitted to and approved by the Council as local
    planning authority before works commence on Phase 1;
    details of the scheme to be planted in association of Phase
    2 shall be submitted to and approved by the Council as
    local planning authority before works commence on Phase 2.
    In both cases, the schemes shall be implemented within one

Condition : 10 - The whole of the proposed development shall be completed in
    accordance with the details shown on the approved drawings
    and Phase 2 of the development shall be commenced not later
    than 3 years from the commencement of Phase 1.

Condition : 11 - Prior to the commencement of Phase 2 of the development the
    applicant shall have entered into a Legal Agreement with
    the Council regarding the provision of measures to reduce
    the speed of traffic leaving the site.
Condition : 12 - To ensure access/egress for people with disabilities.

Condition : 13 - To ensure that adequate parking is provided for staff
    working unsocial hours.

Condition : 14 - to ensure that adequate parking is provided for members of
    the public.
Condition : 15 - To make provision for and encourage the use of cycles.

Condition : 16 - 06, 07. To ensure that the Council will be satisfied with
    the external appearance of the building.

Condition : 17 - Because it is considered that these would seriously detract
    from the appearance of the building.

Condition : 18 - To ensure that the landscaping is carried out within a
    reasonable period and to maintain a satisfactory standard
    of visual amenity in the scheme.

Condition : 19 - In order to ensure that the development is completed and
    occupied as permitted.
Condition : 20 - In the interests of road safety in St Pancras Way.

Condition : 21 - 01Works of construction and ancillary activity should not
    takeplace otherthan between the hours jof 8.00am. to 6.00pm.
    on Monday to Friday and8.00am to 1.00pm. on Saturday, with
    no working on sunday and BankHolidays, in order to comply
    with locally enforced standards. Pleaseconsult the
    Pollution Team of the Planning, Transport and Health
    Serviceto discuss the code of practice for building works
    on large sites.
